entry.title: Bitcoin Whales Bought 1.5M BTC In The Past 6 Months: Smart Money Accumulation?
entry.summary:
Bitcoin is experiencing significant volatility and uncertainty after falling below the $60,000 mark. This dip has sparked mixed reactions among investors. Some view it as a potential bear trap, indicating that the price may soon rally, while others fear that the market could be headed for a deeper correction.
Despite the conflicting sentiments, critical data from CryptoQuant reveals that Bitcoin whales have accumulated BTC heavily over the past six months.
As the price hovers just above the key $60,000 level, many investors speculate about the current market conditions. Could this prolonged accumulation period by large holders signal a bullish outlook for the coming months? Or is the market still at risk of further downside?
Analysts are divided, but the whale activity suggests t…

entry.title: Argentina Leads Latin America With $91 Billion Crypto Inflows – Details
entry.summary:
With over $90 billion worth in crypto inflows, Argentina has been declared Latin America’s leading market for cryptocurrency, dethroning Brazil. The growing instability and unpredictability in the economy as well as inflation has forced people of the country to explore the decentralized world of crypto, immediately making them key players in their region. In fact, it is responsible for almost 25% of the total crypto inflows of Latin America, outweighing that of Brazil at 18%, data from Chainalysis shows. It’s the need for an alternative to banking that drove the nation to adapt digital assets and decentralized banking.
Economic Uncertainty Driving Adoption
Its crypto dominance came from their fair share of economic struggles, problems such as inflation rates due to the fluctuating va…

entry.title: Here’s Why The Bitcoin Price Crashed Below $60,000
entry.summary:
The Bitcoin price briefly crashed below $60,000 for the first time since September. This price decline followed the release of the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation data, which came in higher than expected. This macro data and factors like the US presidential elections are causing market uncertainty, leading to a bearish outlook for the flagship crypto.
Why The Bitcoin Price Crashed Below $60,000
The Bitcoin price crashed below $60,000 following the release of the US CPI inflation data. The CPI showed that inflation in the US hit 2.4% in September, higher than expectations. This provided a bearish outlook for BTC, suggesting that the Fed’s 50 basis points (bps) rate cut might not happen at the November FOMC meeting as expected.
Traders were already pricing into the 50 bps rate…

entry.title: Nigerian Judge Keeps Binance Exec Gambaryan In Jail: Health Fears Not Enough
entry.summary:
A Nigerian Federal High Court has upheld the detention of Tigran Gambaryan, a Binance Holdings Ltd. executive, rejecting his recent bail application on health grounds. The decision, delivered by Justice Emeka Nwite on Friday, maintains Gambaryan’s incarceration despite ongoing concerns regarding his medical condition, as Bloomberg reports.
Binance’s Gambaryan Stays In Jail
Gambaryan, who serves as the head of financial-crime compliance at Binance, has been held at the Kuje Correctional Center in Abuja since February 2024. He faces allegations of money laundering and currency manipulation, charges that have drawn international attention and scrutiny from US lawmakers who argue his detention is unwarranted.
In his ruling, Justice Nwite stated, “A person being ill does not entitle them …

entry.title: MultiBank Sets Up in UAE with MEX Digital’s VARA License for Crypto Assets
entry.summary: MultiBank Group, a global financial institution based in Dubai, has announced the launch of its subsidiary, MEX Digital FZE, in the UAE. MEX Digital has secured a license from the Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority (VARA) in Dubai to operate under the MultiBank.io brand. The license allows the company to offer services as a broker-dealer and exchange for virtual assets, excluding derivatives at this stage. MultiBank.io Secures VASP License According to the firm, this development strengthens MultiBank.io’s position as a Virtual Assets Service Provider (VASP) in the region. entry.summary: BTC ETFs see inflows for 8 straight days. SUI enters top 20, $110m of unlocks today. SOL weekly DEX volume flips ETH. Firedancer sees very fast TPS on Testnet. ETH gas up 500% in 2 weeks. EIGEN opens at $7bn FDV. FTX creditors vote in favour of restructuring plan. Dell to sell another $1.2bn Dell stock. Metaplanet buys another 107 BTC.Grayscale opens decentralised AI fund to investors. Robinhood allows crypto transfer in EU. Pollak to head Coinbase Wallet & join exec team. Gemini to close in Canada. Japan considers lower cap gains tax on crypto. Ohio bill would make it legal to pay taxes in crypto. Trump project opens whitelist to non-US users. CZ pledges to invest in blockchain companies.

entry.title: Binance CEO Richard Teng Talks Progress on Exchange's Global Regulatory Goals
entry.summary: Decrypt Reporters Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano spoke with Binance CEO Richard Teng about the crypto exchange's progress on establishing a global headquarters, improving its relationships with regulators, and expanding its global presence in the wake of founder Changpeng "CZ" Zhao's jailing in the U.S.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 207 - WELCOME BACK TO THE BULL!
entry.summary: Kamala signals support for crypto. Top memecoins all soar, add $10bn in value in a week. MOODENG hits $180m, does 11x in a week. SUI & SEI continue to lead L1s for price & TVL growth. Revolut & Robinhood are considering stablecoin. Visa launches new tokenisation platform for banks. PayPal to allow business accounts to hold crypto Hamster kombat's HMSTER disappoints on launch. Biden admin may have forced Silvergate’s closure. Court rules crypto mining boxes ‘are securities’.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 206 - MEMES ARE PUMPING!
entry.summary: BTC nears $65k key resistance level. Kamala makes positive comments about crypto. PayPal allows businesses to hold crypto. Visa allows banks to test RWAs & smart contracts. Cuban wants to be head of SEC. Silvergate claims about ‘Chokepoint 2.0’ grow. Truflation hacked for $5m. Telegram Wallet blocked in UK & US. Court rules crypto mining boxes are securities. Infinex DeFi platform raises $65m. Ethena announces new stablecoin linked to BUIDL.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 205 - ALTCOINS CONTINUE TO RALLY!
entry.summary: SUI leads L1 gains as TVL crosses $1bn. Altcoin market cap close to breaking downtrend. SEI becomes top chain for 1 month TVL growth. ETH ETFs sees 3rd largest inflow ever. SEC delays ETH ETF options decision. SOL took most of ETH outflows over last 3 months. SOLETH continues to be trading at resistance. $8.1bn BTC options to expire this week. BTC heading to $500k-$1m in a year: PlanB. Stablecoin supply hits new ATH. Caroline Ellison sentenced to 2 years in jail. SBF & Diddy in the same jail. SEC settles against TUSD for not being collateralised. Gensler gets derided for crypto approach. Hester Pierce admits flaws in SEC crypto policy. Harris against regulation by litigation: Cuban. Golem claims ETH move to CEXs due to staking. Binance refutes data leak claims. Next Y combinator batch has ‘no crypto companies’. Celo overtakes Tron for stablecoin addresses.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 204 - MOODENG MOO-NING!
entry.summary: BTC needs to top $65.2k to put in a higher high. ETH ETFs see biggest outflow since July. ETH outperformance could be start of ‘alt season’. BlackRock gets 12hr BTC withdrawal from Coinbase. cbBTC only wrapped BTC to not show reserves. Telegram to share user data upon legal requests. EIGEN non-transferability to be removed Sep 30th. TIA announces $100m funding round. TIA deal was OTC token sale ‘done months ago’. Polymarket considers token, trying $50m raise. Maybe we will pay off debt with crypto: Trump. Harris unlikely to give full crypto policy pre-election. 13m Binance users’ data may have been leaked. Caroline Ellison likely won’t serve time in jail.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 203 - KAMALA GOES PRO-CRYPTO
entry.summary: Crypto funds saw $321m inflows last week. Kamala commits to crypto & AI expansion. TAO leads gains in AI hype, does 2x in 2 weeks. SUI TVL breaks $900m. Average Q4 returns for BTC is 88%. BTC Google searches down 75% since 2021. BTC 161 days from halving, when it rallied in 2020. Crypto VCs raised $2.2bn this year, well below 2021.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 202 - SOL STARTS TO SEND IT
entry.summary: SOL leads majors as Breakpoint begins. SOL launches Frankendancer on mainnet. Helio Pay allows Shopify items to sell on X. Franklin Templeton to launch fund on SOL. BTC short term holders fall at fastest rate in 12 years. MicroStrategy upsizes convertible note raise to $1bn. BingX loses $52m in hack. $243m crypto heist exposed by ZachXBT. Supreme Court of India hacked on X, shills scam. SocGen launches Euro stablecoin on SOL. Sky agrees to stop using WBTC. Germany shuts down 47 crypto exchanges. Stablecoin’s now 18th biggest holder of treasuries. Consensys lawsuit against SEC dismissed. Partisanship will stop Trump crypto plans: Hoskinson. Scaramucci working with Kamala on crypto.
